image.altText: person scuber diviing on reefs in the D’Entrecasteaux Channel

props.synopsis: For more than two decades, Rob Pennicott has taken tourists to see the D'Entrecasteaux Channel. But what he describes as "dead zones" have him so worried that he is funding a study to find what is going wrong.

title.children: 'Dead zones' prompt tour operator to fund marine study

image.altText: a trio of musicians face a crowd of seated guests

props.synopsis: Police charge a man after he allegedly produced a 30-centimetre knife at a Christmas carols event in Launceston.

title.children: Man arrested after allegedly producing knife at Tasmanian Christmas event

image.altText: A young child holds a mobile phone with a padlock graphic embossed over the top.

props.synopsis: For some parents, the social media bans for under-16s have come as a relief. But others say they are fuelling conflict.

title.children: Parents grapple with Australia's social media ban

image.altText: Sunrise over a silhouette jetty and calm waters at St Helens in Tasmania.

props.synopsis: Science communicator Dr Kirsten Banks explains what the summer solstice means depending on which part of Tasmania you live in, and how you can see a festive star formation in the night sky.

title.children: What does the summer solstice mean and how do I see the 'Christmas tree cluster'?

image.altText: People in suits gathered in parliament.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian premier's department authorised more than $13,000 of taxpayer money to be spent with a local media organisation to promote the budget after the government asked for an election to be held, documents show.

title.children: 'Pretty smelly': Government faces questions over advertising spend

image.altText: A large dark grey iron shed with bright orange lettering that reads Adams.

props.synopsis: A work health and safety case against a distillery in Perth, northern Tasmania, is dismissed.

title.children: Man burned in gin fire loses court case against distillery

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt posing for a photo on a street.

props.synopsis: Jessica Seage fought for six years for the man who raped her to be convicted. Experts say her experience is a stark example of how perpetrators abuse the system to inflict more pain on their victims.

title.children: Jessica was raped by her husband. It took six years to finally secure a conviction

image.altText: An action shot of a dark-haired player in a Crows jumper seizing the football and looking downfield.

props.synopsis: A digital marketing agency run by a former AFL star has wiped its millions in debt through an insolvency process, only to open under a new ABN days later. Former staff were left without a job and almost $450,000 in unpaid entitlements, but it's within the bounds of the law and leaves taxpayers footing the bill.

title.children: Insolvent firm run by ex-AFL star wipes millions in debt via 'legal phoenixing'

image.altText: Pipelines leading the LNG terminal and the LNG tanker

props.synopsis: The ASX is rising following tech-led gains on Wall Street overnight. Locally, the federal government announces its intention to start a gas reservation scheme from 2027. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Federal government announces 2027 gas reservation scheme, ASX gains

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Gas scheme aims to reserve up to 25pc of gas production for domestic market

image.altText: Pam Bondi speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Two congressmen say they will recommend United States Attorney-General Pam Bondi be held in contempt of Congress for not releasing all of the Epstein files by the legal deadline.

title.children: US attorney-general faces contempt push over Epstein files

image.altText: A man in front of a poster of a scary clown in a suit.

props.synopsis: James Ransone, an actor best known for playing Ziggy Sobotka in The Wire and also starring in It: Chapter Two, has died, according to LA medical authorities.

title.children: The Wire actor James Ransone dies at age 46

image.altText: Brendon McCullum walks with his head down

props.synopsis: Losing an Ashes Test series in Australia is nothing new for England, but finally the Bazballers are looking inwards after a stirring end to the Adelaide Test.

title.children: Bazball finally admits its failings, albeit far too late

image.altText: A man and a teenager with dark hair, in front of a laptop.

props.synopsis: Pulled out of class, held back after school and forced to prove they're not AI cheats, students say NSW high schools are pitting them against faulty AI detectors.

title.children: High schools demand students prove they are not AI cheats

image.altText: A robot in a lab that looks human-like holds an orange.

props.synopsis: What makes the AI-driven stock market bubble unique in history is that if it's not a bubble, the impact on humanity could be far more challenging than any previous technology.

title.children: Between AI and humanoid robots, we could be at a turning point in history

image.altText: A member of the Critical Incident Response Team of Victoria Police holding a machine gun.

props.synopsis: Officers from the Critical Incident Response Team armed with long-arm weapons will patrol outside the MCG during the upcoming Boxing Day Test.

title.children: Heavily armed specialist police to patrol the MCG during Boxing Day Test

image.altText: An aerial shot of a man in a brown suit stacking rifles on top of each other on a table.

props.synopsis: Straight-pull rapid-fire rifles, social media campaigns, and a looming buyback scheme – Australia's gun debate is reloading.

title.children: Gun dealers warn new gun law reform threatens livelihoods

image.altText: Jenny stands smiling holding up a big canvas with a portrait of herself on it, a woman with short white hair and glasses

props.synopsis: Jenny Croom put her art on hold for her family; now the 77-year-old has been crowned Australia's 2025 Portrait Artist of the Year.

title.children: Jenny thought this art competition was a scam — then she won the whole thing

image.altText: A US military helicopter flying over a large oil tanker at sea.

props.synopsis: If successful, it would be the third oil tanker seized as Donald Trump continues his campaign on President Nicolas Maduro.

title.children: US intercepting third Venezuelan oil tanker amid simmering tensions

image.altText: A black and white photo of a man wearing a dark shirt with a stencil of a house on it, smiling with his thumbs up

props.synopsis: Since 2017, Melbourne building boss Mike Harris has overseen four company collapses. Left behind are clients who have lost their life savings and staff who couldn't pay their mortgages.

title.children: As a building firm collapses, clients want to know 'where the money went'

image.altText: Albanese for Tingle column

props.synopsis: The ABC's political reporters, commentators and broadcasters reflect on what defined the year in politics.

title.children: A triumphant election year for Labor ends on less stable ground for both parties

image.altText: Several police with guns, attend scene, with police vehicles.

props.synopsis: The incident happened just before 1am local time at a licensed tavern in Johannesburg's Bekkersdal township.

title.children: Gunmen kill nine, wound 10 in South Africa bar attack

image.altText: A CCTV image of a man in grey tracksuits.

props.synopsis: On December 13 a gunman killed two Brown University students and wounded nine others, escaping by foot.

title.children: A Reddit user proved vital in locating the Brown University shooting suspect

image.altText: A close up of a man drawing a bow with one eye closed

props.synopsis: Transitioning from "the happiest nation on earth" to a fast-paced Western society is not without its challenges for Perth's booming Bhutanese population, some of whom have taken up archery to improve their mental health.

title.children: Why archery is a lifeline for Bhutanese migrants in Perth

image.altText: A close-up image of a bunch of ripe cherries, still on the tree.

props.synopsis: Ten pickers who worked at Hallmark Cherries' orchard in NSW complain about poorly maintained accommodation and failure to pay an end-of-season bonus.

title.children: Pickers 'living in squalor' claim their end-of-season bonus was unfairly withheld

image.altText: A woman in a red outfit stands on a platform and sings while surrounded by other women in red outfits in front of Stonehenge.

props.synopsis: Crowds make the pilgrimage to the stone circle every summer and winter for what many consider a spiritual experience.

title.children: Thousands cheer as the sun rises on winter solstice at Stonehenge

image.altText: Cooper Scott wears glasses and a grey jumper and has a serious expression

props.synopsis: Victorian teachers say they are exhausted, living almost 100 kilometres from work, as their salaries fail to sustain housing costs.

title.children: Calls for change to help Victorian teachers put a roof over their heads

image.altText: Children's toys including a giraffe inside a car and an abacus.

props.synopsis: Embark Education launches a takeover bid for rival early childcare company Mayfield Education, alarming experts who say providers that fail to meet baseline safety standards are being allowed to expand without oversight.

title.children: Childcare company's bid to more than double in size alarms safety experts

image.altText: Danielle has blond hair wearing a blouse, and Jess, brunette wearing jeans jacket standing with arms around each other

props.synopsis: Despite giving an FBI interview and victim statement, Epstein survivor Jess Michaels finds no trace of her evidence in the vast trove published online.

title.children: 'Another level of betrayal': Survivors search the Epstein files to find nothing

image.altText: Hobart Hurricanes player Nikhil Chaudhary watches a ball go away from him after a shot in a BBL game.

props.synopsis: Hobart star Nikhil Chaudhary launches a ball onto the roof of Kardinia Park in Geelong, but his 79 off 38 is still not enough to earn him player of the match honours in the win over the Renegades.

title.children: Cattery can't hold 'Canes star as six launched onto roof in BBL win

image.altText: The Royal Hotel Capertee

props.synopsis: A man has been charged after seven people were injured when a car crashed into a pub on the New South Wales central tablelands.

title.children: Driver charged after car hits patrons at NSW pub

image.altText: An airline's blue and red logo can be seen painted on the tail of a large commercial plane.

props.synopsis: Direct flights between Darwin and China have resumed for the first time since the COVID-19 pandemic, bringing optimism of a tourism boom for the two countries.

title.children: Hopes new Darwin-to-China flights will bring down domestic airfares

image.altText: Happy couple smiling in outdoor setting.

props.synopsis: The wife of the beloved soccer coach, who died during a home invasion, wants to help break the cycle of youth crime through sport.

title.children: The Zed Team forms in honour of Zdravko Bilic

image.altText: A landscape view of a large lake.

props.synopsis: Almost 100 sensors beside the Federal Highway are helping build the clearest picture yet of the fault beneath the iconic lake.

title.children: How scientists are using traffic noise to map a fault zone under Lake George
